newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: ADCOCK WARNS ON PANADO CHILDREN TABLETS.
newsitem.headline: ADCOCK WARNS ON PANADO CHILDREN TABLETS.

text.p: South African drug firm Adcock Ingram said on Monday that it was possible some of its Panado chewing tablets for children had been issued containing strips of Besenol tablets.
The firm said Besenol could be harmful to children and it urged its customers to check any Panado packets they may have bought.
Adcock added Besenol tablets were white with their name written on them and the packets would contain Besenol instruction leaflets. Panado tablets are pink.

The firm said any customers who were unsure of what tablets they had bought should contact their nearest doctor or pharmacist for advice. The firm said the possible mistake did not effect Panado adult tablets.
"We sincerely apologise for any inconvenience, but wish to assure our customers that we act only in the best interests of their safety," the firm said.
